meanings.definition: To signal or summon someone with a gesture.
meanings.sent1: She beckoned her friend over with a wave.
meanings.sent2: The lighthouse keeper beckoned the ships safely to shore.
meanings.sent3: The cat beckoned the mouse to play a game of chase.
meanings.sent4: The smell of freshly baked cookies beckoned her into the kitchen.
meanings.sent5: The bright neon sign beckoned customers to the store.

meanings.definition: To attract or entice someone with a gesture.
meanings.sent1: The colorful flowers beckoned the butterflies to visit.
meanings.sent2: The aroma of the delicious food beckoned people to the restaurant.
meanings.sent3: The shiny object beckoned the curious child to come closer.
meanings.sent4: The mysterious sound beckoned her to explore the dark cave.
meanings.sent5: The exciting music beckoned everyone to the dance floor.
